column4: why wouldn't it be the actual core temp ? my Athlon XP is rated up to 90C
and a few summers ago it actually ran on 100C for 15 minutes.. when the fan had died.....
because most motherboards are set to stop running around 60 degrees c. if its running that hot, then you have a cooling problem, not a software driving the unit problem...
especially if she can see it in windows and its not that hot...
